Instruction: If using fresh corn, cut the kernels off the cob. If using frozen corn, thaw it.
In a skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the corn kernels to the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Sprinkle flour over the corn and stir to coat.
Slowly pour in the heavy cream, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens.
Stir in sugar, salt, and black pepper.
Continue to cook for another 2-3 minutes, until heated through and creamy.
Serve hot as a comforting and creamy side dish.
